Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy wants to create a new identity for Wales and focus on bonding with the Welsh people and culture.
Bellamy will look for a high-pressing side, a side that will be very busy off the ball as much as they are on it.
He will want Aaron Ramsey to show his talent when fit as a playmaker and he will want the other players to free up room for him.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales begin life under Craig Bellamy this week with Turkey as his first opponents in the UEFA Nations League encounter in Cardiff.
Bellamy has signed a four-year Wales deal and has a new backroom staff to work with him.
The players came in on Sunday evening, but Bellamy is not expecting an initial bounce and is focusing on creating an identity.
Others: Bellamy was intense when he took the job, but has now got the balance right and is enjoying himself.
He wants some patience but is eager to show that Wales has an identity which is ingrained within the Craig Bellamy ethos.
Wales have to qualify for the World Cup in 2026, and Bellamy said he would deliver and that is why he has ultimately been appointed.
